data.title: Find somewhere else!!!
data.text: We gave them a second chance and very unhappy we did.  Just like last time one of the elevators didn't work.  Just like last time service at the restaurant was poor and the meals were totally burnt....should have known again since no one else was there.  Pool below average and hot tub broken down.  Breakfast was very poor especially for price.  Rooms are very average.  Parking lot unattended and had many cars get their windows smashed.  Would never waste my money here again.

data.title: DO NOT PARK YOUR CAR ANYWHERE NEAR THIS HOTEL!!!
data.text: Stayed here because this hotel was on wrestling tournament selected hotels.  I'd estimate that at least 15+ cars in the parking garage had windows smashed in, electronics stolen, everything thrown around. Rooms were OK - old, well worn.  Same for the bath.   Otherwise OK.  Only 1 of the two elevators worked.  Stairways were open despite signs claiming no access - not sure how secure that is.  Saw a lot of new hotels throughout Waterloo and Cedar Falls that would be nicer and safer.

data.title: Your last resort!
data.text: The rooms need renovation! The rooms were described as so luxurious but i got pretty much a regular room. Building had two elevators and one wasn't working. Had a bar on site, but everything i ordered they were out of. Restaurant breakfast way too expensive for what they offered. Parking garage wasn't secure. Travelers including my family members got their car windows smashed. I saw the vandals make trips in and out of the parking garage before area police decided to patroll for them. I'm glad I was just there overnight! Couldn't rest proper after vandals were on the prowl. Definitely not worth the money! Wished I'd stayed elsewhere with a "regular room" and free continental breakfast.

data.title: Nice room
data.text:
Room is great!  Just no frig or microwave, nor breakfast!  Which won't upset me, getting tired of waffles, yogurt, coffee, the standard motel quick breakfast.  Otherwise the room is clean and comfy. For the price, it's perfect.  You can tell it used to be a very rich, classy place.  
For a big city hotel the amenities are slim. They did have coffee in the lobby but no cup tops to take it with you. Elevator was out, but they have two. For a ten story building, one doesn't cut it. The 5th floor ice machine didn't work so we had to go to another floor.
Otherwise it was a quiet night.

data.title: Worst hotel stay I have ever had
data.text: Bugs in my refrigerator and shower.  Found dirty items behind night stand. Cleaning crew did nothing but throw bedding back on bed and empty garbage. Mold and dirt everywhere. The bartenders were pathetic. Not service oriented at all along with the front desk. Just all around horrible and couldn't leave as no other hotels open that weekend unfortunately.

data.title: Average Hotel
data.text:
The room, while generally clean in appearance, but was somewhat run down.  Carpet had multiple stains/gum residue and the sink drained extremely slow.

We were in town for a wedding and the hotel was close to the church and reception, which was nice.

data.title: Not very happy...we will never stay there again
data.text: We were there for a wedding and the people at the reception desk were not very attentive. There was a group of ten of us that stayed there. The elevators were broke . The people working at the bar area also were poor bartenders. It took forever to get served and then when we went in later that evening they just ignored us so we left and went to a bar down the street. The bathroom had hair in the bathtub that looked like they never cleaned it. My friend went down for coffee and had just a spoonful of eggs not realizing you had to pay for it and they charged her $10!! We went for breakfast in Independence and we had paid $10 for two of us to eat a breakfast meal!

data.title: One step up from an hourly rate hotel!
data.text: This place was gross. Mold in window seals, sheets that were pilling, staff that didn't have any answers. The elevators broke while we were there and and employee said, "why can't you take the steps?" (I was on a knee scooter after recent surgery.) The bed was like being on a tilt-a-whirl. Overall I would never stay there again!

data.title: Stayed here for my son's wedding.
data.text: My advice, don't stay here. Find a better place to stay.We stayed here for my son's wedding because it was at the convention center that was attached to the hotel. My husband is in a wheelchair. We park in the ramp because there's a sky walk to the hotel. Starts pretty good. The first two doors have the buttons to push for opening the doors. Get to the next three and the doors need to be held open which isn't easy when you're trying to get a wheelchair through. Get to the room and their idea of a handicap bathroom is to set a shower seat in the tub. My husband can barely pick his feet up much less try to get into a tub to shower. Needs some serious attention. We are trying to relax a bit when we hear a key going in the door, figured maybe it was the maid. It is my daughter, as they have assigned her our room also. They were to have the room next door. Their room also had serious issues. The heat exchanger wouldn't shut off, it was either too hot or too cold. The mattress also sucked in their room.Talked to some of the wedding party and one couple had to get a third room to find one that was acceptable the first two were dirty. Another couple found a used band aid on the floor of the bathroom. The rooms are also very dark in appearance. The TV remote wouldn't change the channels, had to hand input the channels, had to search for a channel directory, which was inside a book, in a drawer. Came back from the wedding and the room hadn't even been cleaned, had to go to the front desk to get coffee for morning and fresh towels  Asked for a comment card at the desk when I checked out and they didn't have any and was told there were some in the room. None to be found in the room. Gee, wonder why they didn't have any. I wouldn't even consider staying here again and I would not recommend it, I think more of people than that.

data.title: not bad at all
data.text: Very nice helpful staff, everyone from shuttle driver pickup at the airport, the front desk staff to the bar tender Janise - a very welcoming staff.  I was very concerned about staying here based on the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised - very clean rooms including the bathrooms, clean & comfortable bed. Nice towels clean and decent size & quality.   If you are looking for a budget friendly place to sleep & shower and don’t mind an older but decent hotel – this is the place.   Not a fancy place but very clean & comfortable with a friendly, caring staff.

data.title: Hotel is in dire need of updates.  Our door looked like it...
data.text: Hotel is in dire need of updates.  Our door looked like it was kicked in.  I understand there was recent water damage so one of the elevators was not working.  Tubs looked gross. Maid made up one bed but not the other?

data.title: Bad weather, bad room(s),  I've had a better experience sleeping on my aunt's couch for FREE
data.text:
My fiance I stayed her for a night to go see a concert at a local bar. When we got there it seem like a normal hotel; a little outdated but no big deal.

We checked in, went upstairs get in our room and the only ceiling light except the bathroom doesn't work...ok. That's dumb but liveable, so we try to use the phone to call down stairs...phone is dead...alright we need a new room we decide.Back downstairs we go with our belongings. 

My fiance asks if we can get a different room and to see if we could up-grade for no additional charge. The front desk gentleman finds us a new room and gives us a suite and we go back upstairs.

Our new room was bigger it had a living space and bedroom but even with all the lights on it was dark...no big deal at least all the lights turned on...great...After we came back from our concert around 11:30-12 it all went down hill from there.

As we came back suddenly the hallway lights started to dim and flutter. It was unnerving but...ok. Then back in our room same thing with our lights, but now it was impossible to see in the bathroom without using the flash light on my phone.

We sit down in the living space, and watch some t.v..I decide to get ice. The hallway is now pitch black except for where the elevators are, so I go back into my room.

I try to call downstairs to let them know...phone is dead. Ok, no big deal...I try to use the restroom again, with the aid of my cell phone...wash my hands and the waters out...great! No one contacted us, or told us what was going on...things just kept getting worse.

My fiance tries to convince me we should just go to bed, we can talk to them in the morning. I try to get into bed...my side is damp and the floor is wet under my feet. It's so wet you can hear water squwish under your toes. "I am not sleeping in there" so, through the pitch black hallway and down the now questionable elevator I go.

When the doors open I see a front desk women and some guys she says are from mid America. "our basement is flooding" she says...I told her my problems with the phone, the water being turned off and the lights and finished with the water on the floor and bed. 

She's says we are on back up generators and the bed must be wet from the a/c unit getting hot, cold, hot cold. She offers to have us change rooms. I decline because it 1am and this our second room. Tell the front desk tomorrow she says, I am sure they will work something out with you.

Back upstairs I go, up in the now very questionable elevator and through the creepy black hall way to my room. I explain everything to my fiance about my conversation and we decide to sleep on the pull out couch in the living room because atleast it was dry. 

As we crawl into this ragged, small pull out bed, wishing we had just stayed with our first room, with our DRY king size bed the power finally goes out. 

That pull out was more uncomfortable, lumpy, and jagged then my aunts couch at Chistmas...and I stay there for free. Also who knows when those sheets were cleaned, but it was our only option so we tried to sleep.

We woke up still with no water, power, or phone and we were misrable and shore from our tiny pull out bed. We exited the room the hallway was still black, except for the light coming in through the windows near the elevator.

Down the very questionable elevator to the lobby we go to check out. We are greeted with "How was your stay?"..."how was my Stay!!??"...really as if this was normal!!??? This was by far one of the worst hotel experience except for a La Quinta in KC that we thought had bedbugs and she asks "how was my stay"???!!

I get that basements flood... Its Iowa..it happens. If this happened at my families house I would at least get a good apology but no. "Sorry to hear that" after I gave her my list of terrible things that happened to us last night. I told her about the water on the floor and she says "thanks will take a look at it"...like this is normal.I tell her we had a horrible nights sleep on our jagged little pull out and I get an "oh sorry."

And to top it all off power is out so she can't check me out. She writes down my email and name, says she will send out an email receipt with the bill in a few days and they will look at discounting my rate. Great, I thought atleast we get that.

Today I check my credit card statement because for a week and a half I have seen nothing on my bill. I think great they gave us the night free for our troubles...no!!! they charged me in full for a horrible hotel expierence with the same amenities as summer camp.

I would even except a discount but not full price. What an outrages, horrible place out horror novel. Just the worst...don't waste your time or money ever on this place.

data.title: Bare minimum
data.text: The room was clean and the people were friendly and helpful. The towels were small and thin. I had to go to the desk to get more. The TV was unfriendly. could not flip through channels. I had to look up channels in the book and enter each one. One of the elevators was out of service all weekend. Also no tissue available. Our room had a sofa but no desk and I use a desk always. This room is what you would expect to pay at half the price.

data.title: Ramada needs some real updating
data.text: There are many problems with this hotel. It is in need of some major updating. Some of the problems were: The counter in the bathroom was falling off the wall.  There was no shower curtain. There was mold in the bathroom. The room had lots of area that hadn't been dusted for some time. Bathroom sink wouldn't drain. They did fix. Carpets and chair were dirty and had lots of stains. We were in room 222 the first night. After we brought to their attention they did send us to another room 417, which was somewhat better but still not what I would expect, also it also had mold on the ceiling.  When we checked in one of the elevators was out of order. on Saturday the other one was not working which they did finally fix.  We had to use the service elevator. I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone else.

data.title: Very on satisfactory
data.text:
The only good thing I can say about this stay at the Ramada was that the bed with comfortable and the clerk was friendly.
 I think it's ridiculous to charge $8.99 for a continental style breakfast.
 after I read several reviews,  I was even more upset about my stay,  Apparently the hot tub has been down since before April.... but I wasn't informed of the amenities being out of service when I was quoted pricing. Very very dissatisfied. And then on top of all that the elevator was broken from morning until afternoon. Needless to say I was on the 7th floor and that was very very tiring having to climb the steps.  I was supposed to get a call from the manager, but still no phone call. I will never stay there again.

data.title: Dirty, un-kept and dilapidated...
data.text:
I usually only write good reviews because I do not want the negatively in my life.... but the Ramada Waterloo Hotel was a pit!
-When making my reservations with the manager "Hillary" I could sense some angst. She was short and not very helpful. I asked about using my Wyndham Rewards to sign in, she insisted it would be difficult to look my number up and to "just do it when you check in.” My wife checked us in and I did not receive my credit. When checking out, I was told it was too late. 
-Upon arrival, the front desk personnel were "frumpy" looking with wrinkled uniforms, additionally, they were all generally uniformed, unconcerned and unaware of the broken elevators. 
-The front desk personnel also had no clue (all front desk staff) that the pool’s hot tub was out of order. One told me it was because of the flood, another said it was regular scheduled maintenance.
-One staff (probably a custodian) told me the pool was closed and out of order (not true).  
-The manager was nowhere to be found the entire weekend. There was a fairly large event occurring throughout the weekend and was surprised at the lack of hotel administration presence.
-Two of three elevators were broke for at least one whole day/night and one elevator was out of order the entire time. The guests had to put of the signs on the elevators, because apparently the front desk did not understand the impact it would have on the guest.
-When the two guest elevators down, I asked if we could use another (early in the morning) and I was told that is only for staff! I was on the 10th floor!!
-The whirlpool suite which I stayed had an out of order whirlpool tub (jets did not function). ---There were some kind of green buildup crude coming out/near all the fixtures of the tub. Someone had to have known this tub was out of order, you could tell it had been unused for quite a while.
-Spider webs, with spiders all over both rooms I stayed in. They moved me to another whirlpool suite once I insisted. 
-The hot tub at the pool was out of order/emptied and filthy looking with a serious need for a paint job.
-If there were a maintenance staff, I did not see one.
-The entire hotel is heavily covered in dust and cob webs (I am not kidding)
-Holes and stains in carpet throughout the hotel.
-The excuse I received at least 3-5 times why everything was such a mess was due to the flood which occurred over two weeks ago, but water did not even touch the hotel.
*The only good experience I can recall would be the kindness of the ladies that made the beds and replaced the towels.

data.title: Two front elevators were out-of-order
data.text: We were there for a conference and had to traverse up and down stairs to get everywhere because the two main elevators were out of order. The room was ok, had a nice desk but no outlet anywhere near the desk to plug in the computer. The restaurant needs better management.

data.title: Ok if you get a cheap price.
data.text: Air didn't work. Comforter was stained. Catered food was dry, cold and had no flavor. Rooms are quite outdated.

data.title: Ok stay nothing great
data.text: Rooms were average nothing great, Booked 2 rooms with 2 queen beds for Friday and Saturday night and one more for Saturday only. Upon check in we were given 2 rooms with 2 beds unfortunately the air in one room did not work so off to another 2 bed room but was not clean  and the only 2 bed room left. Had to settle for 1 king and sofa sleeper which by the way stink to sleep on. On Saturday only got 1 king bed. Oh well will probably not stay here again. No breakfast only coffee for 2 hrs in the morning, Employees were so so.

data.title: In need of some help!
data.text: We stayed at this hotel while attending a family wedding.  The hotel is in need of an overall facelift.  Rooms are mediocre at best and could be cleaner.  Our first room didn't have a card reader that worked, our second room had a hole in the bathroom door.  The room smelled musty and the bed was not comfortable.  The small things were also lacking, a TV guide to let you know what channels were what station would have been nice.  Also - the restaurant was not very inviting and when we tried to order breakfast we were told we had no other choice than the buffet.  Finally, if you want to go swimming good luck - the pool is in a very strange spot in the hotel reminiscent of a horror movie.  The hot tub was not working and had black scum floating on top of the water.  We will not stay here again that is for sure!
